question: Which of the following flipped pattern of LDH is seen in myocardial infarction:
exp: In normal person, LDH-2 is more than LDH-1 in serum. BUT in myocardial infarction, LDH-1>>LDH-2. This is known as Flipped ratio of LDH in Myocardial Infarction. ADDITIONAL EDGE ON ISOENZYMES OF LDH: LDH-2 is raised in haemolytic anemia. (LDH-2 is mainly found in blood (Both WBC and RBC; WBC conc. > RBC conc.)

question: Other name of AST: (PGMEE 2009)
exp: SGOT: Serum Glutamate Oxaloacetate Transaminase - also known as AST i.e. Aspaate transaminase. Aspaate loses amino group and forms oxaloacetate. On the other hand, alpha keto glutarate takes amino group and forms glutamate. SGPT: Serum Glutamate Pyruvate Transaminase - also known as ALT i.e. Alanine transaminase. Alanine loses amino group and forms pyruvate. On the other hand alpha keto glutarate takes amino group and forms glutamate.

question: Not raised in liver disorder is/are:
exp: Lipase and Amylase are used in diagnosis of Pancreatitis Urease is used to estimate urea in lab. ALP ( Alkaline Phosphatase ), AST ( Aspaate Transaminase), ALT (Alanine Transaminase ) are specific for liver. ADDITIONAL EDGE: Table: Enzymes of Diagnostic Impoance Enzyme Diagnostic use Amylase and Lipase Pancreatitis Acid Phosphatase Prostate cancer Alkaline Phosphatase (ALP) Bone, Liver disease an Hypehyroidism Creatine Kinase (CK) Recent Myocardial Infarction Lactate DH (LDH) Myocardial Infarction, Liver diseases, Leukemia Transaminases Myocardial infarction (SGOT), Liver diseases (SGPT)

question: Which isoenzyme has maximum electrophoretic mobility:
exp: Electrophoretic mobility is a common affinity electrophoresis technique used to study protein-DNA or protein-RNA interactions Always number '1' is having maximum electrophoretic mobility. LDH-1 and CK-1 have maximum electrophoretic mobility. LDH-2 has maximum concentration in blood, that's why peak is highest.

question: Abzyme is a/an:
exp: Abzyme is antibody acting as enzyme. It is a monoclonal antibody and is also called catalytic antibody or Catmab. Isozymes (Option 1): Physically distinct form of enzyme which catalyses same biochemical reaction. If species are different then isoenzymes are called alloenzymes. Allosteric enzymes (Option 4) or regulatory enzymes, unlike simple enzymes have regulatory/allosteric site ( other than the active site), where the regulator (activator/inhibitor) binds.

question: Enzyme which cleaves C-C bond :
exp: Lyase enzyme breaks C-C bond. E.g. Aldolase, Synthase . In this case ATP is not used. There are seven groups of enzymes (IUBMB classification): Oxidoreductases: catalyze oxidations and reductions Transferases: catalyze the transfer of groups such as glycosyl or methyl group Hydrolases: catalyze hydrolytic cleavage of C-C, C-O, C-N, and other covalent bonds Lyases: catalyze the cleavage of C-C, C-O, C-N, and other covalent bonds by atom elimination, thereby generating double bonds Isomerases: catalyze structural changes within a molecule Ligases: catalyze the joining together of two molecules in reactions Translocases: catalyze the movement of molecules or ions across membranes

question: Which of the following is a functional plasma enzyme:
exp: Functional plasma enzymes are those enzymes which are present in plasma as they have function in plasma. E.g.: Lipoprotein lipase Clotting Factors e.g. Prothrombin Non -functional plasma enzymes do not have function in plasma, they are present inside cells and tissues. E.g.: SGOT is present in liver and hea. For option A , LDH , only one type of LDH i.e. type 2 is functional plasma enzyme. So,Prothrombin>>>LDH because out of 5 isotypes of LDH only type 2 is a functional plasma enzyme. So, prothrombin is a better option to be marked.

question: Which of the following estimates blood creatinine level most accurately:
exp: There are two methods for estimation of Creatinine in blood: 1. Jaffe's test: In alkaline medium, Creatinine forms a red coloured tautomer of Creatinine Picrate which is measured colorimetrically. This method can be automated in auto-analysers and kinetic method can be used. Kinetic jaffe more accurate than jaffe's method. It gives falsely elevated value of creatinine due to presence of various compounds in serum 2. Enzymatic method: By employing two enzymes Creatininase or Creatinine Deaminase. It is more specific and accurate. There is no interference by Ketones, Bilirubin or Glucose. Hence measure Creatinine accurately.
